00001 
00003 //                                                                            //
00004 //          UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED            //
00005 //                                                                            //
00006 //   Description of this module:                                              //
00007 //      Utility software that interpolates EGM 2008 geoid                     //
00008 //      heights from one of NGA's reformatted geoid height grids.             //
00009 //                                                                            //
00010 //      This interpolator uses Area of Interest (AOI)                         //
00011 //      geoid height grids, not the worldwide geoid height grid.              //
00012 //                                                                            //
00013 //      This interpolator does not load an Area of Interest (AOI)             //
00014 //      geoid height grid until a user first requests a geoid height.         //
00015 //      The interpolator then loads an AOI grid centered near the point of    // 
00016 //      interest, and it interpolates local geoid height from the AOI grid.   //
00017 //      This interpolator re-uses the AOI grid until a subsequent point of    //
00018 //      interest lies outside the AOI.  The interpolator then loads a         //
00019 //      new AOI grid centered at the new horizontal location of interest.     //
00020 //                                                                            //
00021 //      This interpolator gives exactly the same results as                   //
00022 //      the companion egm2008_full_grid_package's interpolator.               //
00023 //      However, the AOI interpolator requires far less computer memory.      //
00024 //                                                                            //
00025 //   Revision History:                                                        //
00026 //   Date         Name          Description                                   //
00027 //   -----------  ------------  ----------------------------------------------//
00028 //   19 Nov 2010  RD Craig      Release                                       //
00029 //   27 Jan 2011  S. Gillis     BAEts28121, Terrain Service rearchitecture    //
00030 //   11 Feb 2011  RD Craig      Updates following code review                 //
00031 //                                                                            //
00033   
00034 // This file contains definitions
00035 // for functions in the Egm2008AoiGrid class.
00036 
00037 #include <fstream>
00038 
00039 #ifdef IRIXN32
00040 #include <math.h>
00041 #else
00042 #include <cmath>
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #include "CCSThreadLock.h"
00046 #include "CoordinateConversionException.h"

00048 #include "egm2008_aoi_grid_package.h"

00051 {
00052    const int    BYTES_PER_DOUBLE = sizeof( double );
00053    const int    BYTES_PER_FLOAT  = sizeof( float );
00054    const int    BYTES_PER_INT    = sizeof( int );
00055 
00056    const int    BYTES_IN_HEADER  = 
00057                    ( 3 * BYTES_PER_INT + 2 * BYTES_PER_DOUBLE );
00058 
00059    const int    NOM_AOI_COLS1    = 100;  // nominal # columns in 1' x 1' AOI grid 
00060    const int    NOM_AOI_ROWS1    = 100;  // nominal # rows    in 1' x 1' AOI grid
00061    const int    NOM_AOI_COLS2_5  =  50;  // nominal # columns in 2.5' x 2.5' AOI grid 
00062    const int    NOM_AOI_ROWS2_5  =  50;  // nominal # rows    in 2.5' x 2.5' AOI grid
00063 
00064    const double PI               = 3.14159265358979323;
00065 
00066    const double PIDIV2           = PI / 2.0;
00067    const double TWOPI            = 2.0 * PI;
00068 
00069    const double DEG_PER_RAD      = 180.0 / PI;
00070    const double RAD_PER_DEG      = PI / 180.0;
00071 
00072    const double DLAT1            = RAD_PER_DEG * (1.0 / 60.0);  // 1' x 1' grid row spacing, radians
00073    const double DLON1            = RAD_PER_DEG * (1.0 / 60.0);  // 1' x 1' grid col spacing, radians
00074    const double DLAT2_5          = RAD_PER_DEG * (2.5 / 60.0);  // 2.5' x 2.5' grid row spacing, radians
00075    const double DLON2_5          = RAD_PER_DEG * (2.5 / 60.0);  // 2.5' x 2.5' grid col spacing, radians
00076 
00077    const double EPSILON          = 1.0e-15;  // ~4 times machine epsilon
00078 
00079    const double SEMI_MAJOR_AXIS  = 6378137.0;              // WGS-84
00080    const double FLATTENING       = 1.0 / 298.257223563;    // WGS-84
00081 }

00093 Egm2008AoiGrid::Egm2008AoiGrid (void)
00094 {
00095    // November  19, 2010: Version 1.00
00096    // February  11, 2011: Version 1.01
00097 
00098    int     status;
00099 
00100    // This function implements the
00101    // default Egm2008AoiGrid constructor.
00102 
00103    // The base class constructor
00104    // initialized most data members.
00105 
00106    // Initialize AOI grid parameters .....
00107 
00108    _minAoiRowIndex =  10000000; // these invalid values
00109    _maxAoiRowIndex = -10000000; // will force the first 
00110    _minAoiColIndex =  10000000; // geoid height request
00111    _maxAoiColIndex = -10000000; // to load a new AOI grid
00112 
00113    _nAoiCols       = 0;
00114    _nAoiRows       = 0;
00115 
00116    _nomAoiCols     = 0;
00117    _nomAoiRows     = 0;
00118 
00119    _heightGrid     = NULL;
00120 
00121    // Get worldwide grid's metadata .....
00122 
00123    status          = this->loadGridMetadata();
00124 
00125    if ( status != 0 )
00126    {
00127       throw MSP::CCS::CoordinateConversionException(
00128          "Error: Egm2008AoiGrid: constructor failed." );
00129    }
00130 
00131 }  // End of Egm2008AoiGrid constuctor

00134 // ***********************************
00135 // * Egm2008AoiGrid copy constructor *
00136 // ***********************************
00137 
00138 Egm2008AoiGrid::Egm2008AoiGrid 
00139    ( const Egm2008AoiGrid&  oldGrid )       // input
00140 
00141 : Egm2008GeoidGrid( oldGrid )               // base class initializer
00142 
00143 {
00144    // November  19, 2010: Version 1.00
00145 
00146    // This function implements 
00147    // the Egm2008AoiGrid copy constructor.
00148 
00149    // Definition:
00150 
00151    // oldGrid:            The Egm2008AoiGrid object being copied.
00152 
00153    int     i;
00154    int     kount;
00155 
00156    // Copy AOI grid's parameters .....
00157 
00158    _maxAoiColIndex   = oldGrid._maxAoiColIndex;
00159    _minAoiColIndex   = oldGrid._minAoiColIndex;
00160 
00161    _maxAoiRowIndex   = oldGrid._maxAoiRowIndex;
00162    _minAoiRowIndex   = oldGrid._minAoiRowIndex;
00163 
00164    _nAoiCols         = oldGrid._nAoiCols;
00165    _nAoiRows         = oldGrid._nAoiRows;
00166 
00167    _nomAoiCols       = oldGrid._nomAoiCols;
00168    _nomAoiRows       = oldGrid._nomAoiRows;
00169 
00170    _heightGrid       = NULL;
00171 
00172    // Copy AOI grid's geoid separations .....
00173 
00174    // (the AOI geoid height grid 
00175    //  will not have been loaded if copying
00176    //  precedes first geoid height interpolation)
00177 
00178    try
00179    {
00180       if ( NULL != oldGrid._heightGrid )
00181       {
00182          kount          = _nAoiRows * _nAoiCols;
00183 
00184          _heightGrid    = new float[ kount ];
00185 
00186          for ( i = 0; i < kount; i++ )
00187          {
00188             _heightGrid[ i ] = oldGrid._heightGrid[ i ];
00189          }
00190       }
00191    }
00192    catch (...)
00193    {
00194       oldGrid._mutex.unlock();
00195 
00196       throw MSP::CCS::CoordinateConversionException(
00197          "Error: Egm2008AoiGrid: copy contructor failed");
00198    }
00199 
00200    oldGrid._mutex.unlock();  // Use CCSThreadMutex in copy constructors
00201 
00202 }  // End of Egm2008AoiGrid copy constuctor

00217 
00218 }  // End of Egm2008AoiGrid destructor

00226 Egm2008AoiGrid::operator= ( const Egm2008AoiGrid&  oldGrid )
00227 {
00228    // November  19, 2010: Version 1.00
00229 
00230    // Definition:
00231 
00232    // oldGrid:            The Egm2008AoiGrid object being assigned.
00233 
00234    int     i;
00235    int     kount;
00236 
00237    // This function implements 
00238    // the Egm2008AoiGrid assignment operator.
00239 
00240    if ( this == & oldGrid )                      return ( *this );
00241 
00242    // Assign most base class data members .....
00243 
00244    Egm2008GeoidGrid::operator= ( oldGrid );
00245 
00246    // Assign AOI grid parameters .....
00247 
00248    _maxAoiColIndex   = oldGrid._maxAoiColIndex;
00249    _minAoiColIndex   = oldGrid._minAoiColIndex;
00250 
00251    _maxAoiRowIndex   = oldGrid._maxAoiRowIndex;
00252    _minAoiRowIndex   = oldGrid._minAoiRowIndex;
00253 
00254    _nAoiCols         = oldGrid._nAoiCols;
00255    _nAoiRows         = oldGrid._nAoiRows;
00256 
00257    _nomAoiCols       = oldGrid._nomAoiCols;
00258    _nomAoiRows       = oldGrid._nomAoiRows;
00259 
00260    // Assign AOI grid's geoid separations .....
00261 
00262    // (the AOI geoid height grid will
00263    //  not have been loaded if assignment 
00264    //  precedes first geoid height interpolation)
00265 
00266    try
00267    {
00268       delete[] _heightGrid;    _heightGrid = NULL;
00269 
00270       if ( NULL != oldGrid._heightGrid )
00271       {
00272          kount          = _nAoiRows * _nAoiCols;
00273 
00274          _heightGrid    = new float[ kount ];
00275 
00276          for ( i = 0; i < kount; i++ )
00277          {
00278             _heightGrid[ i ] = oldGrid._heightGrid[ i ];
00279          }
00280       }
00281    }
00282    catch (...)
00283    {
00284       _mutex.unlock();
00285       oldGrid._mutex.unlock();
00286 
00287       throw MSP::CCS::CoordinateConversionException(
00288          "Error: Egm2008AoiGrid: assignment operator failed");
00289    }
00290 
00291    _mutex.unlock();  // Use CCSThreadMutex function in assignment operations
00292    oldGrid._mutex.unlock();
00293 
00294    return( *this );
00295 
00296 }  // End of Egm2008AoiGrid assignment operator

00299 // *************************************************
00300 // * Find geoid height via 2D spline interpolation *
00301 // *************************************************
00302 
00303 int   
00304 Egm2008AoiGrid::geoidHeight(
00305    int     wSize,                           // input
00306    double  latitude,                        // input
00307    double  longitude,                       // input
00308    double& gHeight )                        // output
00309 {
00310    // November 19, 2010: Version 1.00
00311    // February 11, 2011: Version 1.01
00312 
00313    // This function interpolates 
00314    // geoid heights from an AOI grid,
00315    // which, in turn, was extracted from a
00316    // reformatted version of NGA's worldwide grid.
00317    // It primarily uses BICUBIC-SPLINE INTERPOLATION, 
00318    // but it uses bilinear interpolation for small windows.
00319  
00320    // Definitions:
00321 
00322    // gHeight:               Interpolated geoid height (meters).
00323    // latitude:              Geodetic latitude (radians) at 
00324    //                        which geoid height is to be interpolated. 
00325    // longitude:             Geodetic longitude (radians) at
00326    //                        which geoid height is to be interpolated.
00327    // wSize:                 The number of grid points 
00328    //                        along each edge of the interpolation
00329    //                        window that surrounds the point of interest;
00330    //                        the interpolation window has wSize**2 grid points;
00331    //                        if wSize < 3, then the geoid height 
00332    //                        is computed using bilinear interpolation; the
00333    //                        maximum allowable wSize is twenty grid points;
00334    //                        typical window sizes are 4x4, 6x6, 8,8 etc.
00335 
00336    // i:                     Worldwide grid's latitude  index. 
00337    // j:                     Worldwide grid's longitude index.
00338    // oddSize:               A flag indicating whether the 
00339    //                        local interpolation grid's number
00340    //                        of (rows = column) is even or odd;
00341    //                        oddSize = true  ..... 
00342    //                           the number of rows = columns is odd,
00343    //                           where 3x3, 5x5, 7x7, 9x9, etc are
00344    //                           examples of grids with oddSize = true,
00345    //                        oddSize = false ..... 
00346    //                           the number of rows = columns is even,
00347    //                           where 4x4, 6x6, 8x8, 10x10, etc are
00348    //                           examples of grids with oddSize = false.
00349    //                        The associated indexing logic has two goals:
00350    //                        2) if oddSize = true, select the 
00351    //                           the local grid so that the point of
00352    //                           interest lies near the grid's center,
00353    //                        2) if oddSize = false, select the 
00354    //                           the local grid so that the point of
00355    //                           interest lies in the grid's central cell.
00356    //                        When oddSize = false, the interpolator will
00357    //                        obtain a numerically-most-trustworthy solution.
00358 
00359    try {
00360 
00361       MSP::CCSThreadLock  aLock( &_mutex );  // copy constructor locks thread
00362 
00363       const int           TWENTY = 20;
00364 
00365       bool                oddSize;
00366 
00367       int                 i;
00368       int                 i0;
00369       int                 iIndex;
00370       int                 iMax;
00371       int                 iMin;
00372       int                 j;
00373       int                 j0;
00374       int                 jIndex;
00375       int                 jMax;
00376       int                 jMin;
00377       int                 kIndex;
00378       int                 offset;
00379       int                 status;
00380 
00381       double              latIndex;
00382       double              lonIndex;
00383       double              temp;
00384 
00385       double              latSupport[ TWENTY ];
00386       double              lonSupport[ TWENTY ];
00387       double              moments   [ TWENTY ];
00388 
00389       // EDIT THE INPUT AND INITIALIZE .....
00390 
00391       gHeight = 0.0;
00392 
00393       if ( wSize > MAX_WSIZE ) wSize = MAX_WSIZE;
00394 
00395       if (( latitude < -PIDIV2 ) || ( latitude > PIDIV2 )) return( 1 );
00396 
00397       while ( longitude <   0.0 ) longitude += TWOPI;
00398       while ( longitude > TWOPI ) longitude -= TWOPI;
00399 
00400       if ( TWENTY != MAX_WSIZE )                           return( 1 );
00401 
00402       for (i = 0; i < TWENTY; i++)
00403       {
00404          latSupport[ i ] = lonSupport[ i ] = moments[ i ] = 0.0;
00405       }
00406 
00407       // Determine point indices
00408       // (relative to worldwide grid) .....
00409 
00410       latIndex = 
00411          double( _nGridPad ) + 
00412             ( latitude  + PIDIV2 ) / _dLat;
00413       lonIndex = 
00414          double( _nGridPad ) + 
00415             ( longitude -    0.0 ) / _dLon;
00416 
00417       // Determine interpolation window 
00418       // indices (relative to worldwide grid) .....
00419 
00420       oddSize  = ( wSize != (( wSize / 2 ) * 2 ));
00421 
00422       if ( oddSize ) {
00423         i0   = int( latIndex + 0.5 );
00424         j0   = int( lonIndex + 0.5 );
00425 
00426         iMin = i0 - ( wSize / 2 );
00427         jMin = j0 - ( wSize / 2 );
00428       }
00429       else { 
00430         i0   = int( latIndex );
00431         j0   = int( lonIndex );
00432 
00433         iMin = i0 - ( wSize / 2 ) + 1;
00434         jMin = j0 - ( wSize / 2 ) + 1;
00435       }
00436 
00437      iMax      = iMin + wSize - 1;
00438      jMax      = jMin + wSize - 1;
00439 
00440      // Compare interpolation 
00441      // window's limits to AOI grid's 
00442      // limits, and reload AOI grid if required .....
00443 
00444      if (( iMin < _minAoiRowIndex ) ||
00445          ( iMax > _maxAoiRowIndex ) ||
00446          ( jMin < _minAoiColIndex ) ||
00447          ( jMax > _maxAoiColIndex ))
00448      {
00449         status = this->loadAoiParms( i0, j0 );
00450 
00451         if ( status != 0 )                                 return( 1 ); 
00452 
00453         status = this->loadGrid();
00454 
00455         if ( status != 0 )                                 return( 1 );
00456      }
00457 
00458      // COMPUTE BILINEAR INTERPOLATION .....
00459 
00460      // (executes only when the interpolation window
00461      //  is too small for bicubic spline interpolation)
00462 
00463      if ( wSize < 3 )        
00464      {
00465         status = 
00466            this->geoidHeight( latitude, longitude, gHeight );
00467 
00468         if ( status != 0 )                                 return( 1 );
00469 
00470         ;    /* Normal bilinear interpolation return */    return( 0 );
00471      }
00472 
00473      // COMPUTE BI-CUBIC SPLINE INTERPOLATION .....
00474 
00475      // Compute interpolation window's 
00476      // relative column coordinate at which the
00477      // first set of geoid heights will be interpolated ....
00478 
00479      temp    = 
00480         lonIndex - double( jMin ); // 0 <= temp <= (wSize - 1)
00481 
00482      // Interpolate a synthetic geoid height 
00483      // for each row within the interpolation window .....
00484 
00485      for ( i = 0; i < wSize; i++ ) 
00486      {
00487         iIndex = iMin + i - _minAoiRowIndex;              // AOI referenced
00488 
00489         offset = ( _nAoiRows - iIndex - 1 ) * _nAoiCols;
00490 
00491         // Load interpolation window's 
00492         // i-th row of tabulated geoid heights ..... 
00493 
00494         for ( j = 0; j < wSize; j++ ) 
00495         {
00496            jIndex          = jMin + j - _minAoiColIndex;  // AOI referenced
00497 
00498            kIndex          = jIndex + offset;  
00499 
00500            lonSupport[ j ] = _heightGrid[ kIndex ];
00501         }
00502 
00503         // Compute moments, 
00504         // interpolate the i-th row's geoid 
00505         // height at the longitude of interest, 
00506         // then load the i-th latitude support point .....
00507 
00508         status          = 
00509            this->initSpline( wSize, lonSupport, moments );
00510 
00511         if ( status != 0 )                                 return( 1 ); 
00512 
00513         latSupport[ i ] = 
00514            this->spline( wSize, temp, lonSupport, moments ); 
00515      }
00516 
00517      // Compute interpolation window's 
00518      // relative row coordinate at which the
00519      // final geoid height will be interpolated .....
00520 
00521      temp     = 
00522         latIndex - double( iMin );  // 0 <= temp <= (wSize - 1)
00523 
00524      // Compute moments, and interpolate final 
00525      // geoid height at the latitude of interest .....
00526 
00527      status   = 
00528         this->initSpline( wSize, latSupport, moments ); 
00529 
00530      if ( status != 0 )                                    return( 1 ); 
00531 
00532      gHeight  = 
00533         this->spline( wSize, temp, latSupport, moments );
00534 
00535      // Thread is unlocked by aLock's destructor;
00536      // this occurs even when exceptions are thrown.
00537 
00538    } // End of exceptions' try block
00539 
00540    catch ( ... ) {                                         return( 1 ); }
00541 
00542    return ( 0 );  // Normal-return flag
00543 
00544 }  // End of function Egm2008AoiGrid::geoidHeight
00545 
00546 
00547 // **********************
00548 // ** Hidden functions **
00549 // **********************
00550 
00551 // ************************************** 
00552 // * Interpolate EGM 2008 geoid heights * 
00553 // ************************************** 
00554  
00555 int
00556 Egm2008AoiGrid::geoidHeight(
00557    double  latitude,                        // input
00558    double  longitude,                       // input
00559    double& gHeight )                        // output
00560 { 
00561    // November  19, 2010: Version 1.00
00562  
00563    // This function, which is
00564    // exercised only when wSize < 3, uses
00565    // bilinear interpolation to find geoid heights.
00566 
00567    // Definitions:  
00568 
00569    // gHeight:               Interpolated geoid height (meters).
00570    // latitude:              GEODETIC latitude at which 
00571    //                        nominal geoid height is to be computed. 
00572    // longitude:             GEODETIC longitude at which 
00573    //                        nominal geoid height is to be computed. 
00574 
00575    // wSize:                 The local interpolation window's size:
00576    //                        normally wSize = 6 for EGM 2008 interpolations.
00577 
00578    // Thread locks are not needed here, because this function
00579    // can only be invoked by the bicubic spline's geoidHeight function; 
00580    // the thread locks reside in the bicubic spline's geoidHeight function.
00581 
00582    try {
00583 
00584       int           i1;
00585       int           i1ww;
00586       int           i2;
00587       int           i3;
00588       int           i4;
00589       int           index;
00590       int           j1;
00591       int           j1ww;
00592       int           j2;
00593       int           j3;
00594       int           j4;
00595       int           status;
00596 
00597       double        a0;
00598       double        a1;
00599       double        a2;
00600       double        a3;
00601       double        lat1;
00602       double        lon1;
00603       double        n1;
00604       double        n2;
00605       double        n3;
00606       double        n4;
00607       double        x;
00608       double        y;
00609 
00610       // EDIT THE INPUT AND INITIALIZE .....
00611 
00612       gHeight = 0.0;
00613 
00614       if (( latitude < -PIDIV2 ) || ( latitude > PIDIV2 )) return( 1 );
00615 
00616       while ( longitude <   0.0 ) longitude += TWOPI;
00617       while ( longitude > TWOPI ) longitude -= TWOPI;
00618 
00619       // Compute the surrounding 
00620       // points' worldwide grid indices .....
00621 
00622       status  = 
00623          this->swGridIndices
00624             ( latitude, longitude, i1, j1 );
00625 
00626       if ( status != 0 )                                   return( 1 ); 
00627 
00628       i1ww    = i1;  // save worldwide index
00629       j1ww    = j1;  // save worldwide index
00630 
00631       i2      = i1;
00632       j2      = j1 + 1;
00633 
00634       i3      = i1 + 1;
00635       j3      = j2;
00636 
00637       i4      = i3;
00638       j4      = j1;
00639 
00640       // Compute the 
00641       // corresponding AOI grid indices .....
00642 
00643       i1     -= _minAoiRowIndex;
00644       j1     -= _minAoiColIndex;
00645 
00646       i2     -= _minAoiRowIndex;
00647       j2     -= _minAoiColIndex;
00648 
00649       i3     -= _minAoiRowIndex;
00650       j3     -= _minAoiColIndex;
00651 
00652       i4     -= _minAoiRowIndex;
00653       j4     -= _minAoiColIndex;
00654 
00655       // GET THE SURROUNDING GRID POINTS' GEOID HEIGHTS .....
00656 
00657       index   = 
00658          j1 + ( _nAoiRows - i1 - 1 ) * _nAoiCols;
00659       n1      = _heightGrid[ index ];
00660 
00661       index   = 
00662          j2 + ( _nAoiRows - i2 - 1 ) * _nAoiCols;
00663       n2      = _heightGrid[ index ];
00664 
00665       index   = 
00666          j3 + ( _nAoiRows - i3 - 1 ) * _nAoiCols;
00667       n3      = _heightGrid[ index ];
00668 
00669       index   = 
00670          j4 + ( _nAoiRows - i4 - 1 ) * _nAoiCols;
00671       n4      = _heightGrid[ index ];
00672 
00673       // INTERPOLATE GEOID HEIGHT AT THE POINT OF INTEREST .....
00674 
00675       // Set bilinear coefficients .....
00676 
00677       a0      = n1;
00678       a1      = n2 - n1;
00679       a2      = n4 - n1;
00680       a3      = n1 + n3 - n2 - n4;
00681 
00682       // Set first ( S/W ) corner's geodetic coordinates .....
00683 
00684       lat1    = 
00685          _baseLatitude  + _dLat * double( i1ww ); // radians
00686       lon1    = 
00687          _baseLongitude + _dLon * double( j1ww ); // radians
00688 
00689       // Set point coordinates relative
00690       // to the grid square's S/W corner .....
00691 
00692       // 0 <= x <= 1;             0 <= y <= 1.
00693 
00694       x       = ( longitude - lon1 ) / _dLon;
00695       y       = ( latitude  - lat1 ) / _dLat;
00696 
00697       // Perform the interpolation .....
00698 
00699       gHeight = a0 + a1 * x + a2 * y + a3 * x * y;   // meters
00700 
00701    }  // End of exceptions' try block
00702 
00703    catch ( ... ) {                                         return( 1 ); }
00704 
00705    return( 0 );  // Normal-return flag
00706  
00707 } //  End of function Egm2008AoiGrid::geoidHeight 
00708 
00709 
00710 // ************************************
00711 // * Compute new AOI's new parameters *
00712 // ************************************
00713 
00714 int
00715 Egm2008AoiGrid::loadAoiParms(
00716    int     i0,                              // input
00717    int     j0 )                             // input
00718 {
00719    // November 19, 2010: Version 1.00
00720    // February 11, 2011: Version 2.00:
00721    // the function's name was changed following code review
00722 
00723    // This function determines 
00724    // current AOI grid parameters.
00725 
00726    // Definitions;
00727 
00728    // i0:                    Worldwide row index
00729    //                        for geoid height post that's
00730    //                        near the ground point of interest.
00731    // j0:                    Worldwide column index
00732    //                        for geoid height post that's
00733    //                        near the ground point of interest.
00734 
00735    // THRESHOLD:             Compute the E/W horizontal 
00736    //                        distance between grid columns
00737    //                        a) at the equator (ewDelta0) and
00738    //                        b) at the latitude of interest (ewDelta);
00739    //                        then form the ratio ( ewDelta / ewDelta0 );
00740    //                        THRESHOLD is the minimum allowable E/W ratio,
00741    //                        where ratio controls the # of AOI grid columns.
00742 
00743    // Thread locks are not needed here, because this function
00744    // can only be invoked by the bicubic spline geoidHeight function;
00745    // the thread locks reside in the bicubic spline's geoidHeight function.
00746 
00747    try {
00748 
00749       const double  THRESHOLD = 0.05;  // unitless
00750 
00751       int           status;
00752 
00753       double        cLat;
00754       double        eSquared; 
00755       double        ewDelta;
00756       double        ewDelta0;
00757       double        latitude;
00758       double        longitude;
00759       double        nRadius;
00760       double        ratio;
00761       double        sLat;
00762       double        temp;
00763 
00764       // INITIALIZE .....
00765 
00766       // Compute latitude & longitude
00767       // corresponding to indices i0 & j0 .....
00768 
00769       status     = 
00770          this->loadGridCoords(
00771             i0, j0, latitude, longitude );
00772 
00773       if ( status != 0 )                                   return( 1 );
00774 
00775       cLat       = cos( latitude );
00776       sLat       = sin( latitude );
00777 
00778       // Compute earth ellipsoid's
00779       // radius of curvature in the prime vertical .....
00780 
00781       eSquared   = FLATTENING * ( 2.0 - FLATTENING );
00782 
00783       temp       = 1.0 - eSquared * sLat * sLat;
00784 
00785       nRadius    = SEMI_MAJOR_AXIS / sqrt( temp );
00786 
00787       // Set AOI grid's number of rows and columns .....
00788 
00789       ewDelta0   = SEMI_MAJOR_AXIS * _dLon;
00790 
00791       ewDelta    = nRadius * _dLon * cLat;
00792 
00793       ratio      = ewDelta / ewDelta0;
00794 
00795       if ( ratio < THRESHOLD ) ratio = THRESHOLD;
00796 
00797       _nAoiCols  = int( double( _nomAoiCols ) / ratio ); 
00798 
00799       _nAoiCols  = 2 * ( _nAoiCols / 2 );    // These both
00800       _nAoiRows  = 2 * ( _nomAoiRows / 2 );  // become even numbers
00801 
00802       // SET AOI GRID'S ABSOLUTE LOCATION .....
00803 
00804       // (indices are referenced to the worldwide grid)
00805 
00806       _minAoiRowIndex = i0 - (( _nAoiRows - 2 ) / 2 ) + 1;
00807       _maxAoiRowIndex = _minAoiRowIndex + _nAoiRows - 1;
00808 
00809       _minAoiColIndex = j0 - (( _nAoiCols - 2 ) / 2 ) + 1;
00810       _maxAoiColIndex = _minAoiColIndex + _nAoiCols - 1;
00811 
00812       // MOVE AOI GRID IF IT EXTENDS
00813       // BEYOND A WORLDWIDE GRID BOUNDARY .....
00814 
00815       if ( _minAoiRowIndex < 0 ) 
00816       {
00817          _minAoiRowIndex = 0;
00818          _maxAoiRowIndex = _minAoiRowIndex + _nAoiRows - 1;
00819       }
00820 
00821       if ( _maxAoiRowIndex >= _nGridRows ) 
00822       {
00823          _maxAoiRowIndex = _nGridRows - 1;
00824          _minAoiRowIndex = _maxAoiRowIndex - _nAoiRows + 1;
00825       }
00826 
00827       if ( _minAoiColIndex < 0 )
00828       {
00829          _minAoiColIndex = 0;
00830          _maxAoiColIndex = _minAoiColIndex + _nAoiCols - 1;
00831       }
00832 
00833       if ( _maxAoiColIndex >= _nGridCols ) 
00834       {
00835          _maxAoiColIndex = _nGridCols - 1;
00836          _minAoiColIndex = _maxAoiColIndex - _nAoiCols + 1;
00837       }
00838 
00839    }  // End of exception's try block
00840 
00841    catch ( ... ) {                                         return( 1 ); }
00842 
00843    return( 0 );  // Normal return flag
00844 
00845 }  // End of function Egm2008AoiGrid::loadAoiParms
00846 
00847 
00848 // ******************************
00849 // *  Read reformatted version  * 
00850 // * of NGA's geoid-height grid *
00851 // ******************************
00852 
00853 int
00854 Egm2008AoiGrid::loadGrid( void )
00855 {
00856    // November  19, 2010: Version 1.00
00857    // February  11, 2011: Version 2.00:
00858    // the function's name was changed following code review
00859 
00860    // This function reads 
00861    // AOI geoid heights from NGA's
00862    // reformatted EGM 2008 geoid height file.
00863 
00864    // The grid data is arranged in latitude rows, 
00865    // with the northernmost rows first, and with the
00866    // geoid heights arranged west-to-east within each row. 
00867 
00868    // Thread locks are not needed here, because this function
00869    // can only be invoked by the bicubic spline geoidHeight function;
00870    // the thread locks reside in the bicubic spline's geoidHeight function.
00871 
00872    try {
00873 
00874       int            endRow;
00875       int            i;
00876       int            index0;
00877       int            index1;
00878       int            index2;
00879       int            kount;
00880       int            startCol;
00881       int            startRow;
00882 
00883       std::ifstream  fin;
00884 
00885       // INITIALIZE .....
00886 
00887       fin.open( 
00888          _gridFname.c_str(), 
00889             std::ifstream::binary | std::ifstream::in ); 
00890 
00891       if ( fin.fail() )                                    return( 1 );
00892 
00893       delete[] _heightGrid;    _heightGrid = NULL;
00894 
00895       _heightGrid = new float[ _nAoiRows * _nAoiCols ];
00896 
00897       if ( NULL == _heightGrid )                           return ( 1 );  
00898 
00899       // READ THE AOI GRID's GEOID HEIGHTS .....
00900 
00901       index0      = 0;       // Starting AOI grid locaion
00902 
00903       startRow    = _maxAoiRowIndex;  
00904       endRow      = _minAoiRowIndex;
00905 
00906       index1      =          // Starting worldwide file location (bytes)
00907          BYTES_IN_HEADER + 
00908             BYTES_PER_FLOAT *
00909                ( _minAoiColIndex +
00910                   ( _nGridRows - startRow - 1 ) * _nGridCols );
00911 
00912       for ( i = startRow; i >= endRow; i-- ) 
00913       {
00914          // Read row's geoid heights .....
00915 
00916          fin.seekg( index1 );
00917 
00918          fin.read( 
00919             (char*) ( &_heightGrid[ index0 ] ), 
00920                ( _nAoiCols * BYTES_PER_FLOAT ));
00921 
00922          if ( fin.fail() ) { fin.close();                  return( 1 ); }
00923 
00924          // If needed, convert to LITTLE-ENDIAN format .....
00925 
00926          #if LITTLE_ENDIAN
00927 
00928             this->swapBytes( 
00929                &_heightGrid[ index0 ], 
00930                BYTES_PER_FLOAT, _nAoiCols ); 
00931 
00932          #endif
00933          
00934          index0 += _nAoiCols;
00935          index1 += ( BYTES_PER_FLOAT * _nGridCols );
00936       }
00937 
00938       fin.close();
00939 
00940    }  // End of exceptions' try block
00941 
00942    catch ( ... ) {                                         return( 1 ); }
00943 
00944    return ( 0 );  // Normal-return flag
00945 
00946 }  // End of function Egm2008AoiGrid::loadGrid
00947 
00948 
00949 // *******************************
00950 // * Read header's metadata from *
00951 // *     reformatted version     * 
00952 // * of NGA's  geoid-height grid *
00953 // *******************************
00954 
00955 int
00956 Egm2008AoiGrid::loadGridMetadata( void )
00957 {
00958    // November  19, 2010: Version 1.00
00959    // February  11, 2011: Version 2.00:
00960    // the function's name was changed following code review
00961 
00962    // This function reads 
00963    // the grid metadata from NGA's 
00964    // reformatted EGM 2008 geoid height file. 
00965 
00966    // THE GRID METADATA OCCUPIES 28 BYTES AT THE
00967    // BEGINNING OF THE REFORMATTED WORLDWIDE FILE.
00968 
00969    // Thread locks are not needed here, because this
00970    // function can only be invoked by the constructor;
00971    // thread locks / unlocks reside in the constructors.
00972 
00973    try {
00974 
00975       std::ifstream  fin;
00976 
00977       // INITIALIZE .....
00978 
00979       fin.open( 
00980          _gridFname.c_str(), 
00981             std::ifstream::binary | std::ifstream::in ); 
00982 
00983       if ( fin.fail() ) {                                  return( 1 ); }
00984 
00985       // READ AND STORE HEADER .....
00986 
00987       fin.read((char*) &_nGridPad,  BYTES_PER_INT );
00988 
00989       if ( fin.fail() ) { fin.close();                     return( 1 ); }
00990 
00991       fin.read((char*) &_nOrigRows, BYTES_PER_INT );
00992 
00993       if ( fin.fail() ) { fin.close();                     return( 1 ); }
00994 
00995       fin.read((char*) &_nOrigCols, BYTES_PER_INT );
00996 
00997       if ( fin.fail() ) { fin.close();                     return( 1 ); }
00998 
00999       fin.read((char*) &_dLat,      BYTES_PER_DOUBLE );
01000 
01001       if ( fin.fail() ) { fin.close();                     return( 1 ); }
01002 
01003       fin.read((char*) &_dLon,      BYTES_PER_DOUBLE );
01004 
01005       if ( fin.fail() ) { fin.close();                     return( 1 ); }
01006 
01007       fin.close();
01008 
01009       #if LITTLE_ENDIAN
01010 
01011          this->swapBytes( &_nGridPad,  BYTES_PER_INT,    1 );
01012          this->swapBytes( &_nOrigRows, BYTES_PER_INT,    1 );
01013          this->swapBytes( &_nOrigCols, BYTES_PER_INT,    1 );
01014          this->swapBytes( &_dLat,      BYTES_PER_DOUBLE, 1 );
01015          this->swapBytes( &_dLon,      BYTES_PER_DOUBLE, 1 );
01016 
01017       #endif
01018 
01019       _dLat         *= RAD_PER_DEG;  // grid file stores these in degrees
01020       _dLon         *= RAD_PER_DEG;  // grid file stores these in degrees
01021 
01022       // SET DERIVED METADATA .....
01023 
01024       _nGridRows     = _nOrigRows + ( 2 * _nGridPad );
01025       _nGridCols     = _nOrigCols + ( 2 * _nGridPad ) + 1;
01026 
01027       if ((( _dLat - EPSILON ) <      DLAT1 ) &&
01028           (( _dLat + EPSILON ) >      DLAT1 ) &&
01029           (( _dLon - EPSILON ) <      DLON1 ) &&
01030           (( _dLon + EPSILON ) >      DLON1 ))
01031       {
01032          _nomAoiCols = NOM_AOI_COLS1;
01033          _nomAoiRows = NOM_AOI_ROWS1;
01034       }
01035       else if ((( _dLat - EPSILON ) < DLAT2_5 ) &&
01036                (( _dLat + EPSILON ) > DLAT2_5 ) &&
01037                (( _dLon - EPSILON ) < DLON2_5 ) &&
01038                (( _dLon + EPSILON ) > DLON2_5 ))
01039       {
01040          _nomAoiCols = NOM_AOI_COLS2_5;
01041          _nomAoiRows = NOM_AOI_ROWS2_5;
01042       }
01043       else
01044       {
01045          ;                                                 return( 1 );
01046       }
01047 
01048       _baseLatitude  =
01049          -PIDIV2 - _dLat * double( _nGridPad );     // radians
01050       _baseLongitude =
01051              0.0 - _dLon * double( _nGridPad );     // radians
01052 
01053    }  // End of exceptions' try block
01054 
01055    catch ( ... ) {                                         return( 1 ); }
01056 
01057    return( 0 );  // Normal-return flag
01058 
01059 }  // End of function Egm2008AoiGrid::loadGridMetadata
01060 
01062 //          UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED            //
